definitions.definition: A written work edited and published , as by a certain editor or in a certain manner, or at a certain time.
examples: She wanted a copy of the Clericotes edition , but had to settle for the 1921 edition .  She had never liked abridged editions .

definitions.definition: The whole number of copies of a work printed and published at one time.
examples: The first edition was soon sold.

definitions.definition: An instance of the first or second sense .
examples: What he had found was a particularly valuable first edition .

definitions.definition: A particular instance of an event.
examples: The 2014 edition of the Tour de France started in Leeds, Yorkshire.

main_definition: ( publishing ) A written work edited and published , as by a certain editor or in a certain manner, or at a certain time.
secondary_definitions: The whole number of copies of a work printed and published at one time.
An instance of the first or second sense .
( sports ) A particular instance of an event.
